lines.text: Change in angular velocity per unit time

definitions.def: The rate of change of angular velocity.

secText: Angular acceleration ends our discussion of the variables and concepts needed to describe rotational motion.

In the first diagram, we show a train moving faster and faster as it moves clockwise around the track.  The increasing angular displacement between images captured at equal time intervals shows the angular acceleration. Angular acceleration measures the train’s change in angular velocity per unit time, just as linear acceleration measures the rate of change of linear velocity.
We show the equation for an average or constant angular acceleration. The Greek letter α (alpha) represents angular acceleration.
